location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.129 of 1856 from Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, relating to the treatment of the owners of vessels flying British flags at Muscat. The enclosure is the translation of a letter (folio 150) from Jones to the Native Agent at Muscat, dated 22 March 1856, instructing the Native Agent that correspondence on such matters should be addressed to the Resident, and issuing instructions to be followed in the event of further ill-treatment of British subjects at Muscat.
